go_data.justification: The silencing of the myospheroid (mys, beta-PS integrin) gene by RNA interference slowed down border cell migration.
Beta-PS integrin is part of the focal adhesion complex along with alpha-PS2 integrin and talin.
The expression of a Talin head-GFP fusion polypeptide in the border cells restored the normal migration rate in CalpB505 mutant egg chambers.
The downregulation of the CalpB gene by mutations or RNA interference results in a delayed migration of the border cells in Drosophila egg chambers.
Beta-PS integrin is part of the focal adhesion complex.
